subject: p12074041
History: -year-old with hypoxia, fever and question infiltrate on left lower lobe, assess for interval progression. Comparison to at 17:0 Portable upright chest film at 5:18 is submitted.
Impression: Interval improvement in aeration. No focal airspace consolidation is appreciated on the current examination and therefore the previously described abnormality likely reflected atelectasis which has resolved in the interim. There is no evidence of pulmonary edema, pneumothorax or pleural effusions. Overall cardiac and mediastinal contours remain stable given relatively diminished lung volumes.
